alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Clay; Jackson; Lee; Magoffin; Owsley; Perry; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 11:10PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Owsley, northwestern Perry, southeastern Jackson, Breathitt, west central Magoffin, southeastern Lee, southeastern Wolfe and northern Clay Counties through 1145 PM EDT... At 1110 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Lexie to Yeadon to Major to Benge. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Jackson, Simpson, Upper Gilmore, Rosefork, Gilmore, Elkatawa, Yeadon, Gentry, Lexie and Chenowee around 1115 PM EDT. Burkhart, Dumont, Curt, Inverness, Shockey, Quicksand, Howard Creek, Arnett, Rock Lick and Moct around 1120 PM EDT. Lucky Fork, Lost Creek, Haddix, Mountain Valley, Smith Branch, Portsmouth, Mistletoe, Copland, Saldee and Little around 1125 PM EDT. Cornelia, Flintville, Valjean, Clayhole, Dalesburg, Morris Fork, Bays, Horse Creek Junction, Watts and Wilstacy around 1130 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Buckhorn, Hardshell, Boho, Saul, Beech, Ned, Guage, Camp Lewis, Spurlock, Barcreek, Noble, Buckhorn Lake S.P., Hector, Gays Creek, Enline, Bush Branch, Altro, Lunah, Wolf Coal, Barwick and Jacks Creek. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 47 and 56. Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 21 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Breathitt; Clay; Jackson; Lee; Magoffin; Owsley; Perry; Wolfe
